com.whirvis.jraknet.windows

Class PowerShellCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.whirvis.jraknet.windows.PowerShellCommand

  • public final class PowerShellCommand
extends java.lang.Object
    A command that can be executed in the Windows PowerShell environment under the Windows 10 operating system.

    Commands can be created and executed on devices that do not have Windows PowerShell. However, they will ultimately not be executed.

    Since:
    JRakNet v2.10.0
    Author:
    Whirvis T. Wheatley

        Parameters:
        command - the command string. To allow for the use of arguments, use "$" before the argument name.

                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the value of the argument.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the value of the argument, null if the argument has not been set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argumentName does not begin with the "$" character.

      • execute

        public java.lang.String execute(boolean requiresElevation)
                         throws PowerShellException
        Executes the command. Once the command has been executed, its arguments will be cleared so they do not linger in the case the same command with different arguments is executed.

        Take note that a PowerShellException not being thrown is not an indication that the command actually executed. Rather, it just means that the execution of this method in particular did not fail. The main case of this is being a command not being executed either because the machine is not running on Windows 10 or that it requires elevation but the user declined.

        Parameters:
        requiresElevation - true if the PowerShell command should be executed under an elevated process, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        the execution result.
        Throws:
        PowerShellException - if a PowerShell error occurs.

      • execute

        public java.lang.String execute()
                         throws PowerShellException
        Executes the command. Once the command has been executed, its arguments will be cleared so they do not linger in the case the same command with different arguments is executed.

        Take note that a PowerShellException not being thrown is not an indication that the command actually executed. Rather, it just means that the execution of this method in particular did not fail. The main case of this is being a command not being executed either because the machine is not running on Windows 10 or that it requires elevation but the user declined.

        Returns:
        the execution result.
        Throws:
        PowerShellException - if a PowerShell error occurs.
